message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of decreased sensation in the right lower extremity and loss of nasal field in the left eye and temporal field in the right eye with macular sparing suggest an infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery. Herpes simplex encephalitis typically presents with fever and altered mental status.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a stroke, and the nasal field loss in the left eye and temporal field loss in the right eye with macular sparing suggest an infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a stroke, which affects blood supply to the brain. The loss of nasal field in the left eye and temporal field in the right eye with macular sparing suggest a lesion of the left posterior cerebral artery.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest a stroke, with the patient experiencing headache, blurring of vision, and numbness of the right leg. The loss of nasal field in the left eye and the temporal field in the right eye with macular sparing indicate an infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery, which supplies the occipital lobe. Herpes simplex encephalitis typically presents with fever, seizures, and altered mental status, which are not present in this case. Infarctions of the anterior cerebral artery typically present with leg weakness and cognitive dysfunction, but not with visual loss.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a stroke, and the loss of nasal field in the left eye is associated with a stroke in the posterior cerebral artery. The fact that the patient can write but not read phrases suggests a language disturbance or aphasia, which is also associated with a stroke in the posterior cerebral artery. None of the other options match the symptoms described.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including headache, blurring of vision, and numbness of the right leg, suggest a neurological issue. The loss of the nasal field in the left eye and the temporal field in the right eye with macular sparing is characteristic of an infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery, which supplies the occipital lobe of the brain responsible for vision.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including blurred vision, numbness, and decreased sensation on the right lower extremity, suggest a stroke. The confrontation test shows loss of the nasal field in the left eye and the temporal field in the right eye, which is characteristic of a left posterior cerebral artery infarct. The other options are less likely causes of the patient's symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a stroke, and the loss of nasal field in the left eye and temporal field in the right eye with macular sparing indicates an infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery. All other options involve the right side of the brain or a viral infection.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a stroke, and the loss of the nasal field in the left eye and the temporal field in the right eye with macular sparing are indicative of an infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery. The other options are unlikely as they do not affect the same regions of the brain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a stroke in the right hemisphere of the brain, which can cause vision loss in the left visual field and weakness or numbness on the right side of the body. Among the options, only infarct of the left posterior cerebral artery can cause these symptoms.
